Abstract: The advent of CRISPR technology has revolutionized the field of biosensing, offering unprecedented precision and versatility in the detection of nucleic acids, proteins, and small molecules. This review explores the technical advancements in CRISPR-based biosensing strategies, highlighting their development from simple nucleic acid detection tools to sophisticated systems capable of identifying a wide range of biomolecules. We delve into the mechanisms underlying CRISPR biosensors, including the role of CRISPR-associated proteins and guide RNAs in target recognition and signal amplification. Furthermore, we discuss the application prospects of these biosensors in various fields such as medical diagnostics, environmental monitoring, and food safety. The potential for integration with other technologies, such as microfluidics and nanotechnology, is also examined, paving the way for the development of next-generation biosensing platforms. This review underscores the transformative impact of CRISPR technology on biosensing and its promising future in advancing analytical sciences.
